Name: Statuette of Harpocrates
Description: Statuette of Harpocrates standing, in a walking position, with his left arm down his side, the hand closed, and the index finger of the right hand at the lips. He is wearing the double crown, adorned with an uraeus. The eyes must have been inlaid, but are now lost. The statuette rests on a pedestal which has an engraved text in Phoenician.
